name: I'm So Glad We Had This Time Together by Maurice Vellekoop – By the Lake Book Club
description:
I'm So Glad We Had This Time Together, by 2024 Toronto Book Award winner Maurice Vellekoop, is a graphic memoir tracing his journey from a queer boy in a strict Christian home to a renowned artist. Set in 1970s Toronto, it delves into family, faith, sexuality, and art's transformative power, blending humor and poignancy.

By the Lake Book Club hosts six Tuesday-night events from February to December with top Canadian authors and Humber Polytechnics alumni. Each in-person event features readings, discussions, Q&A, book signings, and ASL interpretation, while virtual sessions include live subtitles and audio access.

name: Wet Paint Escape
description:
A vibrant fusion of classic analogue escape-room gameplay and the joyful chaos of a paint-splatter studio.
Players must solve handcrafted puzzles and pop-culture-inspired clues to unlock paint weapons, new colour palettes, surprise tools, and fresh canvases, all while embracing the liberating fun of throwing, brushing, spinning, and spraying UV neon paint.

Designed for teams of 2 to 6 players, Wet Paint Escape invites guests to navigate a dynamic, art-driven challenge in just 45 minutes. Each team concludes their adventure with a take-home canvas masterpiece, with the option to purchase additional paintable props or even bring their own items from home to customize in-game. 

Because each group follows new artistic missions or their own creative whims, no two plays of Wet Paint Escape will ever be the same, encouraging guests to return for entirely new outcomes. To keep guests safe and comfortable, Trivia Escape Rooms provides all protective gear and uses non-toxic, washable paints.

name: Toronto Welsh Male Voice Choir: Christmas Concert
description:
Join us for a fun and uplifting evening of song.

Christmas favourites old and new. Audience carols. Welsh songs.

organizer.name: The Stephen Lewis Foundation Grandmothers Campaign

name: Festive Lights at Ontario's Legislative Building
description:
Bring the whole family together this holiday season for an unforgettable celebration of free and festive fun! 

Enjoy hands-on crafts, seasonal activities, and live music. Meet Santa and beloved characters. Stroll through the park, surrounded by the glow of the holiday lights, and snap photos under dazzling displays both inside and outside the Legislative Building. Explore Ontario's history while surrounded by holiday cheer and browse the Legislative Gift Shop for unique Ontario-made treasures. 

Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, join us for a fun-filled day for the whole family. We look forward to welcoming you.

name: Midtown's Gingerbread Lane
description:
Watch the neighbourhood transform into a festive stroll of custom gingerbread storefronts created by talented bakers. 

Explore each display, vote for your favourite and enjoy a full lineup of holiday programming throughout the month, including a pop-up holiday market, family day activities and a raffle contest.

name: TSO Holiday Pops
description:
Jingle all the way! 

This year's festive spectacular is led by guest conductor Sarah Hicks, joined by the radiant Mikaela Bennett and the uplifting voices of VIVA Singers Toronto who together bring soaring vocals to timeless classics and traditional favourites. 

From sparkling melodies to rousing choruses and a carol singalong, this joyful concert is the perfect way to share the spirit of the season with family and friends, making memories that will last a lifetime.

name: Youth Arts Mentorship at Todmorden Mills
description: Discover the vibrant voices of eight young Toronto artists under the mentorship of Amani Bin Shikhan at Todmorden Mills Heritage Site.  These emerging artists explore the theme of HOME through multidisciplinary art installations featuring a group poem, acrylic and watercolour paintings, photography, zines, collage and digital art. This installation is produced under the Youth Arts Mentorship program, which empowers emerging talent to experience self-discovery and artistic expression through visual arts.

name: U of T Startup Holiday Market 2025
description:
Looking for one-of-a-kind gifts and the chance to support emerging local businesses right here on campus? 
Visit the U of T Startup Holiday Market for a festive event showcasing innovative products and services available for purchase from the University of Toronto's brightest entrepreneurs. 
No registration required – just come by and shop UTE local! 

Participating vendors include: 
Eatable Foods Inc., 
Ecopal, 
Elemental Notes, 
FWPT, 
Ginny, 
Happy Cramps, 
Indus Space, 
La Luméa, 
Morning Breath, 
My Dorm Store, 
NORM , 
PosePone, 
Sleepyeve, 
Uma, 
Wild Whimsy Woolies, 
Yogi Delight. 

This is more than a holiday market—it's a unique opportunity to engage with Toronto's entrepreneurship community, find memorable gifts and show your support for U of T's entrepreneurs.

name: Minute Madness Toronto
description:
We believe that a capable filmmaker can tell a story in just 60 seconds.

Join us as we screen 60 micro-short films from all over Canada and around the world! 

Please visit our website for the list of movies to be screened.

name: Montgomery's Inn Holiday Farmers' Market
description: Join us at Montgomery's Inn for a special Holiday Market filled with homemade treats, handcrafted treasures, and the famous Innovator fruitcake. Discover unique gifts, enjoy seasonal goodies, along-side the all year round Farmers' Market. Don't miss this once a year special event that brings the Etobicoke community together.

name: Yum Market

location.name: Victor Philip Dahdaleh Building, York University Campus

description:
Through our YUM Market we provide access to a diverse selection of fresh & healthy, locally-grown, locally-made or locally-sourced, fairly-traded, natural and organic foods & products using a model that creates the least environmental impact and reflects the diversity and values of the community.

 September – April on a weekly basis every Wednesday from 11 am to 4 pm, apart from holidays, reading weeks and exam periods.

name: Pete Eastmure
description:
Pete Eastmure grew up on a horse farm on the Blue Mountains near Collingwood, Ontario. At the age of 18, he hitchhiked off the farm and began a long musical journey that led him to California.

Pete has been described as a "an authentic Canadian voice" and been compared to the likes of John Hartford, Gordon Lightfoot, and American musician-producer Joe Henry. He has released five studio Albums from 1998 to 2023, with the the latest being "Devil's Taxi 2023".

He has been received a "4/5 Star" review from Maverick Magazine UK., 2023 and a "Honourable Mention in American Songwriter Magazine Lyric Contest" 2019.

name: Curtis Bowman
description:
Bit of country, bit of pop.

Smooth, raw, dreamy, like a hazy pink and blue sunset so arrestingly sweet that it stops you in your tracks, you have no choice but to let it wash over you. 

Gentle yet scuzzy,  his songs are country-tinged, but without pretense or posturing, they're country by happenstance. 

Curtis sings as if he found the notes floating around in the sky, as though he didn't have to try very hard to find something very real and true.
